alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Brooks; Cook; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:11AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN COOK...SOUTHEASTERN BERRIEN...LANIER...LOWNDES AND EASTERN BROOKS COUNTIES THROUGH 600 AM EDT... At 511 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Pearson to near Quitman. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Park, Lakeland, Valdosta, Quitman, Hahira, Ray City, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Meigs, Dasher, Morven, Barretts, New Lois, Hansell, Nankin, Empress, Clyattville, Brooks Co A/p, and I-75 At Exit 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
